intro: Comparettia bigibbosa, commonly known as the two-lipped orchid, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with a distinctive two-lipped structure. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to tree trunks or branches in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers, which bloom in spring or summer, are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, showcasing the plant's ecological significance in its native habitat.
